ent.origin: Old English Ã¦ppel, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch appel and German Apfel.

p.def: The round fruit of a tree of the rose family, which typically has thin green or red skin and crisp flesh.
p.eg: Jackson picked up an apple from the bowl of fruit, tossed it in the air, caught it, then bit into it.

ent.rhy: chapel, chappal, Chappell, dapple, grapple, scrapple
